de.iabg.mesh
Interface GeometryReader

All Known Implementing Classes:
NastranBulkDataReader
public interface GeometryReader

This interface declares basic functionality for parsing a file containing geometric data, namely nodes, edges, triangles, and quadrilaterals. In general, the user should call readFile() so that the parser reads and internally stores the data of the file. The data can then be safely parsed and extracted without having to stream file data multiple times.

Version:
September 10, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

Method Summary

Method Detail

importEdges

void importEdges(NodeConnectionMatrix edges)
Clears the given edges and replaces them with the data parsed from the internally stored file. This method should be called after readFile(), otherwise no data will be saved.

Parameters:
edges - the NodeConnectionMatrix where the data will be stored

importNodes

void importNodes(NodeMatrix nodes)
Clears the given nodes and replaces them with the data parsed from the internally stored file. This method should be called after readFile(), otherwise no data will be saved.

Parameters:
nodes - the NodeMatrix where the data will be stored

importQuadrilaterals

void importQuadrilaterals(NodeConnectionMatrix quads)
Clears the given quadrilaterals and replaces them with the data parsed from the internally stored file. This method should be called after readFile(), otherwise no data will be saved.

Parameters:
quads - the NodeConnectionMatrix where the data will be stored

importTriangles

void importTriangles(NodeConnectionMatrix triangles)
Clears the given triangles and replaces them with the data parsed from the internally stored file. This method should be called after readFile(), otherwise no data will be saved.

Parameters:
triangles - the NodeConnectionMatrix where the data will be stored

readFile

void readFile()
              throws java.io.IOException
Internally saves the data from the file for later use. The format of the lines may be altered as required to more easily parse the file.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file could not be read
